p:
Wu et al.
52 extracted antroquinonol ( 15), a novel compound with anti-inflammatory activities, from the mycelium of Antrodia camphorata
53
,
54 . Ho et al.
6 measured the inhibitory effect of Antroquinonol on various of tumours such as human lung cancer, liver cancer, and leukaemia. Antroquinonol plays a major role in interrupting the function of Ras and Ras-related GTP-binding proteins by inhibiting the activity of FTase and GGTase in cancer cells, ultimately resulting in cell death. At present, antroquinonol is in the phase 2 clinical trials in patients with non-small cell lung cancer
6
,
55
,
56 .
